title: 4 Quick and Easy Ways to Turn Off Your iPhone

steps.title: Press and hold a volume button and the right side button simultaneously.
steps.content: Press and hold a volume button and the right side button simultaneously. It doesn't matter which volume button you press. After holding down these buttons for a few seconds, a slider will appear on the screen. [1] X Research source If you don't hold down long enough, you might take a screenshot .

steps.title: Drag the slider to the right.
steps.content: Drag the slider to the right. This powers off your iPhone. It can take up to 30 seconds for your iPhone to power down. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Press and hold the right side button to turn the iPhone back on.
steps.content: Press and hold the right side button to turn the iPhone back on. You can lift your finger from the button once the Apple logo appears. [3] X Research source You may need to wait a few moments until you can use your iPhone . If your device is unresponsive, you can perform a hard reset .

steps.title: Press and hold the right side button.
steps.content: Press and hold the right side button. It's near the top of the phone on the rightmost edge. After a few seconds, a slider will appear. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Drag the slider to the right.
steps.content: Drag the slider to the right. Swipe the button from the left of the "slide to power off" message to the right and your iPhone will power off. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Press and hold the right side button to turn the iPhone back on.
steps.content: Press and hold the right side button to turn the iPhone back on. You can lift your finger from the button once the Apple logo appears. If you need to force restart an iPhone 7 or 7 Plus, press and hold the Volume down and Power button until you see the Apple logo. Once the logo appears, release both buttons and wait for the device to reboot. [6] X Research source To restart an iPhone 8 or 8 Plus, press and release the Volume up button, then press and release the Volume down button. Press and hold the Power button until you see the Apple logo appear. Once that happens, release the power button and wait for the device to reboot. [7] X Expert Source Josef Storzi Apple & Mobile Phone Repair Specialist Expert Interview. 7 December 2020.

steps.title: Press and hold the top button.
steps.content: Press and hold the top button. It's on the top of your iPhone close to the right edge. In a few seconds, a slider will appear.

steps.title: Drag the slider to the right.
steps.content: Drag the slider to the right. This powers down your iPhone. It can take about 30 seconds for your iPhone to turn off.

steps.title: Press and hold the top button to turn your iPhone back on.
steps.content: Press and hold the top button to turn your iPhone back on. Lift your finger from the button once the Apple logo appears on the screen. To force restart your device, hold the Home and Power button until the Apple logo appears. Once the logo appears, immediately release both buttons and wait for the device to reboot. [8] X Expert Source Josef Storzi Apple & Mobile Phone Repair Specialist Expert Interview. 7 December 2020.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings . It's the gear icon that's typically on your home screen, although it may be inside of a folder. [9] X Research source Be sure to update your iPhone . [10] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap General.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap General . You can find this in the middle of the screen, above Control Center . [11] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Shut Down.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Shut Down . It's all the way at the bottom of the menu. After a second or so, a slider will appear. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Drag the slider right to power down your iPhone.
steps.content: Drag the slider right to power down your iPhone. Your device will shut down To turn your iPhone on again, press and hold the Power button until the Apple logo appears. If you're having trouble with your iPhone's touchscreen, you can change its touch sensitivity .
